perturbation.original_text:
(f)
Governing Law:
This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed and enforced in accordance with, the laws in force in the Province of Ontario
(excluding any conflict of laws rule or principle which might refer such construction to the laws of another jurisdiction). The Parties hereto
agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the Province of Ontario and waive any objection relating to improper venue or
forum non conveniens to the conduct of any proceeding in any such court.
perturbation.changed_text:
(f)
Governing Law:
This Agreement shall be governed by, and construed and enforced in accordance with, the laws in force in the Province of Prince Edward Island
(excluding any conflict of laws rule or principle which might refer such construction to the laws of another jurisdiction). The Parties hereto
agree to submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the courts of the Province of Prince Edward Island and waive any objection relating to improper venue or
forum non conveniens to the conduct of any proceeding in any such court.
perturbation.explanation: The original governing law clause specifies Ontario law, which is directly relevant and enforceable. By changing the jurisdiction to Prince Edward Island, which has little to no connection to the parties or subject matter, the clause becomes less relevant and potentially unenforceable, causing a legal contradiction. This is because courts often look to the jurisdiction with the most significant relationship to the contract. Since the company in question resides in Ontario, this presents a jurisdictional challenge.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Conflict of Laws Principles, Contract Law (Jurisdiction and Venue)

perturbation.original_text:
(c)
Interest on Late Payments:
Where CHT fails to pay any amount in accordance with the payment terms set out in Schedule “6”, Ehave shall have the right, in addition
to any other rights or remedies available to it, to charge, and CHT shall pay, interest on such overdue amounts at the rate of 1% per month
calculated daily, compounded monthly (12.68% per annum) both before and after any court judgement in respect of the same from the date
such payment was due.
perturbation.changed_text:
(d)
Exhibits and Schedules
The following Schedules are a part of and are integral to this Agreement:
Schedule “1”
-
Ehave Companion Solution Specifications
Schedule “2”
-
Development and Implementation Plan
Schedule “3”
-
Support Procedures
Schedule “4”
-
Service Level Commitments
Schedule “5”
-
Security Requirements
Schedule “6”
-
Royalties and Early Termination Fee
Schedule “7”
-
Source Code Escrow
(c)
Interest on Late Payments:
Where CHT fails to pay any amount in accordance with the payment terms set out in Schedule “6”, Ehave shall have the right, in addition
to any other rights or remedies available to it, to charge, and CHT shall pay, interest on such overdue amounts at the rate of 1% per month
calculated daily, compounded monthly (12.68% per annum) both before and after any court judgement in respect of the same from the date
such payment was due.
perturbation.explanation: This relocates the interest on late payments clause to follow directly after exhibits and schedules, a section where it is not expected, as it would typically fall under financial terms or payment conditions. This could reduce clarity and make the term harder to find, as the reader may assume financial terms are detailed elsewhere. Furthermore, placing the clause in a position where it disrupts the expected flow of contract structure reduces its emphasis and could potentially lead to oversight during review.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Contract Law (Disclosure Requirements, Clarity of Terms)

perturbation.original_text:
(b)
Security Requirements
Ehave shall implement and maintain those safeguards and controls set out in Schedule “5” to deter and for the detection, prevention and
correction of any unauthorized intrusion, access or use of the Ehave Companion Solution, as well as to protect against any loss, theft or
unauthorized access, use, disclosure, copying, or modification of End User Data. CHT acknowledges and agrees, and shall obtain such
acknowledgement and agreement from its End Users, that notwithstanding the Security Requirements, such methods and procedures may
not prevent unauthorized electronic intruders to access the Ehave Companion Solution through the Internet or through other form of
electronic communication. If such unauthorized electronic intruders are able to bypass Ehave’s security protocols, firewall and safeguards,
such unauthorized electronic intruder may change, delete or otherwise corrupt the contents and data contained in the Ehave Server,
including any End User Data. Except for the maintenance of appropriate firewall and safeguards in compliance with the Security
Requirements, which are designed to frustrate access from unauthorized electronic intruders, Ehave shall not be liable to CHT or to any of
its End users, and hereby disclaims responsibility, with respect to any action, destructive or otherwise, by any unauthorized electronic
intruder.
perturbation.changed_text:
(h)
Language:
It is the Parties desire and agreement that this Agreement and all Exhibits and associated documentation be drafted in English. Les Parties
conviennent que la présente convention et tous les documents s’y rattachant, soient rédigés en anglais.
(b)
Security Requirements
Ehave shall implement and maintain those safeguards and controls set out in Schedule “5” to deter and for the detection, prevention and
correction of any unauthorized intrusion, access or use of the Ehave Companion Solution, as well as to protect against any loss, theft or
unauthorized access, use, disclosure, copying, or modification of End User Data. CHT acknowledges and agrees, and shall obtain such
acknowledgement and agreement from its End Users, that notwithstanding the Security Requirements, such methods and procedures may
not prevent unauthorized electronic intruders to access the Ehave Companion Solution through the Internet or through other form of
electronic communication. If such unauthorized electronic intruders are able to bypass Ehave’s security protocols, firewall and safeguards,
such unauthorized electronic intruder may change, delete or otherwise corrupt the contents and data contained in the Ehave Server,
including any End User Data. Except for the maintenance of appropriate firewall and safeguards in compliance with the Security
Requirements, which are designed to frustrate access from unauthorized electronic intruders, Ehave shall not be liable to CHT or to any of
its End users, and hereby disclaims responsibility, with respect to any action, destructive or otherwise, by any unauthorized electronic
intruder.
perturbation.explanation: By relocating the 'Security Requirements' clause to after the section describing the language of the contract, this reduces its importance and makes it difficult to find. Placing security requirements in an irrelevant section misdirects the reader, leading them away from the part of the contract that handles the security obligations of Ehave. This can particularly affect enforcement if a data breach or security incident occurs, as the obligations are buried far from the actual performance or warranties of the software solution, which in turn can affect the obligations under privacy and data protection laws.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Data Protection Laws (e.g., PIPEDA in Canada), Contract Law (Disclosure Requirements)
